law.text: Any person who has been a resident of any United States Army post, military reservation or fort within the State of Kentucky for sixty (60) days, or a resident of this state who has resided on such United States Army post, military reservation or fort together aggregating sixty (60) days before filing the petition, may bring an action for adoption of a child in any county adjacent to said army post or military reservation.
law.history: Amended 1976 Ky. Acts ch. 352, sec. 1. -- Created 1958 Ky. Acts ch. 76, sec. 1.
